title: Social Media Utilization Strategies in Higher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in social media platforms and advanced expertise in education/social studies fields
context.additional_context: Collaboration and discussion-centered education based on practical experience in a smartphone-dominated, limited technological environment

learning_goals: Building a social media-based collaborative learning community among learners improves project outcomes by over 20%.
Achieve a score of 3.5 or higher on a 4-level evaluation scale for analyzing social issues using real-time discussion features.
Produce authentic learning artifacts applying field cases in portfolio format and earn over 80 points based on expert evaluation criteria.

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
